com.eemi.ext4j.client.data

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.JsObject
      • com.eemi.ext4j.client.data.Store
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayStore, JsonStore, TreeStore

    public class Store
extends JsObject
    The Store class encapsulates a client side cache of DataModel objects. Stores load data via a ProxyConfig, and also provide functions for sorting, filtering and querying the model instances contained within it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Store(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject obj) 
      Store(java.util.List<? extends BaseModel> data)
      This constructor allows a Store to be created; it MUST contain at least one element, since the Store's fields will be derived from the first element in the Store.

        public static Store instance(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject obj)

      • count

        public int count()

      • setBuffered

        public void setBuffered(boolean value)
        Allows the Store to prefetch and cache in a page cache, pages of Records, and to then satisfy loading requirements from this page cache.

        To use buffered Stores, initiate the process by loading the first page. The number of rows rendered are determined automatically, and the range of pages needed to keep the cache primed for scrolling is requested and cached. Example:

        Parameters:
        value -

      • setClearOnPageLoad

        public void setClearOnPageLoad(boolean value)
        True to empty the store when loading another page via loadPage, nextPage or previousPage. Setting to false keeps existing records, allowing large data sets to be loaded one page at a time but rendered all together.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setDefaultSortDirection

        public void setDefaultSortDirection(boolean value)
        The default sort direction to use if one is not specified.

        Defaults to: "ASC"

      • setPageSize

        public void setPageSize(int value)
        The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions when the grid is paged using a PagingScroller Defaults to 25.

      • setProxyConfig

        public void setProxyConfig(ProxyConfig proxy)

      • setPurgePageCount

        public void setPurgePageCount(int value)
        The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions when the grid is paged using a PagingScroller Defaults to 25.

      • setRemoteFilter

        public void setRemoteFilter(boolean value)
        True to defer any filtering operation to the server. If false, filtering is done locally on the client.

        Defaults to: false

      • setRemoteGroup

        public void setRemoteGroup(boolean value)
        true if the grouping should apply on the server side, false if it is local only. If the grouping is local, it can be applied immediately to the data. If it is remote, then it will simply act as a helper, automatically sending the grouping information to the server.

        Defaults to: false

      • setRemoteSort

        public void setRemoteSort(boolean value)
        True to defer any sorting operation to the server. If false, sorting is done locally on the client.

        Defaults to: false

      • setSortOnFilter

        public void setSortOnFilter(boolean value)
        For local filtering only, causes sort to be called whenever filter is called, causing the sorters to be reapplied after filtering.

        Defaults to: true

      • setSortOnLad

        public void setSortOnLad(boolean value)
        If true, any sorters attached to this Store will be run after loading data, before the datachanged event is fired. Defaults to true, igored if remoteSort is true

        Defaults to: true

      • setSortRoot

        public void setSortRoot(boolean value)
        The property in each item that contains the data to sort.

        Available since: Ext 4.1.3

      • setStoreId

        public void setStoreId(java.lang.String value)
        Unique identifier for this store. If present, this Store will be registered with the Ext.data.StoreManager, making it easy to reuse elsewhere.

        Note that when store is instatiated by Controller, the storeId will be overridden by the name of the store.

      • setTraillingBufferZode

        public void setTraillingBufferZode(double value)
        When buffered, the number of extra records to keep cached on the trailing side of scrolling buffer as scrolling proceeds. A larger number means fewer replenishments from the server.

        Defaults to: 25

      • filter

        public void filter(java.lang.String property,
          java.lang.String value)
        Filters the loaded set of records by a given set of filters.

        By default, the passed filter(s) are added to the collection of filters being used to filter this Store.

      • filter

        public void filter()
        Filters the loaded set of records by a given set of filters.

        By default, the passed filter(s) are added to the collection of filters being used to filter this Store.

      • filter

        public void filter(SorterConfig... sorterConfigs)

      • filterBy

        public void filterBy(FilterFunction filterFunction)
        Filters by a function. The specified function will be called for each Record in this Store. If the function returns true the Record is included, otherwise it is filtered out.

        When store is filtered, most of the methods for accessing store data will be working only within the set of filtered records. Two notable exceptions are queryBy and getById.

      • clearFilter

        Parameters:

      • getGroupDirection

        public SortDirection getGroupDirection()

      • setGroupField

        public void setGroupField(java.lang.String value)
        The (optional) field by which to group data in the store. Internally, grouping is very similar to sorting - the groupField and groupDir are injected as the first sorter (see sort). Stores support a single level of grouping, and groups can be fetched via the getGroups method.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setGroupField

        public void setGroupField(java.lang.String value,
                 Direction direction)
        The (optional) field by which to group data in the store. Internally, grouping is very similar to sorting - the groupField and groupDir are injected as the first sorter (see sort). Stores support a single level of grouping, and groups can be fetched via the getGroups method.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • findBaseModel

        public <T extends BaseModel> T findBaseModel(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    int startIndex,
                                    boolean anyMatch,
                                    boolean caseSensitive,
                                    boolean exactMatch)
        fieldName : String The name of the BaseModel field to test. value : String/RegExp Either a string that the field value should begin with, or a RegExp to test against the field. startIndex : Number (optional) The index to start searching at anyMatch : Boolean (optional) True to match any part of the string, not just the beginning caseSensitive : Boolean (optional) True for case sensitive comparison exactMatch : Boolean (optional) True to force exact match (^ and $ characters added to the regex). Defaults to false.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        value -
        startIndex -
        anyMatch -
        caseSensitive -
        exactMatch -
        Returns:

      • addGroupingHandler

        public java.lang.String addGroupingHandler(GroupingHandler handler)
        Returns the string to group on for a given model instance. The default implementation of this method returns the model's groupField, but this can be overridden to group by an arbitrary string.
        Parameters:
        handler -
        Returns:

      • getTotalCount

        public int getTotalCount()
        Returns the total number of DataModel instances that the ProxyConfig indicates exist. This will usually differ from getCount when using paging - getCount returns the number of records loaded into the Store at the moment, getTotalCount returns the number of records that could be loaded into the Store if the Store contained all data

      • loadData

        public void loadData(java.util.ArrayList<? extends BaseModel> data,
            boolean append)
        Loads an array of data straight into the Store
        Parameters:
        data - , Array of data to load
        append - , True to add the records to the existing records in the store, false to remove the old ones first
